bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Raquel Romero, November 26, 1944

div1.p: Hench discusses the mural on which she is currently working. He hopes to receive a photograph or newspaper clipping when it is unveiled.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Raquel Romero, November 26, 1944
div1.opener:
PSH/cb
26 November, 1944
Senora Raquel Romero
Calle 23
No. 309 Altos, Vedado
Habana, Cuba
My dear Senora Romero:
div1.p:
Permit me to enclose a couple of snapshots which I took when
you visited me. May I say that your visit gave me great pleasure. My
only regret was that you were unable to stay longer. I am not at all
sure that it was worth your while to come out here. I am not sure that
I gave you enough help; nevertheless, it was a real pleasure to me, and
I appreciated greatly the opportunity of seeing your preliminary sketch.

Recently, in New York, I was delighted to meet Doctor Ramos,
who told me that he thought your mural was almost completed. I am most
anxious to see copies of the finished product, and hope that you will
remember to send me whatever you can in the way of a photograph or news-
paper clipping, when it is unveiled. I have taken the liberty of sending
a little enlargement of the enclosed photograph of your sketch to Mrs.
Lazear, and also to one or two others especially interested in the Yellow
Fever story.
div1.closer:
Always sincerely yours, PHILIP S. HENCH, Lt. Col., M.C.
Chief of the Medical Service Painting is in
Agramonte Hosp
Ciudad Militar
Enc.
